intro: Galium hercynicum var. transiens, commonly known as the Transylvanian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and typically oval or elliptical in shape. Galium hercynicum var. transiens thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
